page.title: 11RELIGION IN BRAILES
page.content: Within the village there are three different places of worship.For members of the Church of England there is the Parish Church of St. George, with a resident vicar who is also responsible for St.Thomas Beckett, Sutton-Under-Brailes. Roman Catholics from Brailes and nearby villages attend services at the church of St.Peter and St.Paul, conducted by a visiting priest based at Ilmington.This church of great historical interest is situated on the first floor of the old Rectory Farm barn. Ministers and lay preaches from the Banbury area come to Brailes to hold services at the Methodist Church, founded in the 19th century. United Services,attended by all denominations,are held throughout the year.
